sen.j: 奥 八兵衛（おく はちべえ、生年不詳 - 寛文9年1月23日 (旧暦)（1669年2月23日））は、江戸時代、京都の魚屋（河内屋）である。
sen.e: Hachibei OKU (year of birth unknown-February 23, 1669) run the fish store (Kawachiya) in Kyoto in the Edo period.

sen.j: 代々、魚類を御厨に納めることを家業とした。
sen.e: For generations, his family business was to provide fish to mikuriya (manors of Imperial family and powerful shrines).

sen.j: 後光明天皇のとき、火葬が不仁であることを説いたことを聞いて深い感銘を受けた。
sen.e: He was so impressed to hear that the Emperor Gokomyo preached that the cremation was lack of clemency.

sen.j: 承応3年（1654年）、天皇の崩御に際して、先例によって火葬の式が行なわれることを伝え聞いて心を痛め、ただちに仙院から、後宮、官吏に至るまでを訪ねまわり、火葬は天皇の考えにもとることをるる説明し、涙を流して土葬の行なわれることをひたすら懇請した。
sen.e: Because he was distressed to hear that cremation would be held as before for the death of that emperor in 1654, he immediately visited Sen-in to kokyu (empress's residence) and government officials and tearfully appealed for holding the burial, explaining that cremation should be held based on the emperor's belief.

Because he was distressed to hear that cremation would be held as before for the death of that emperor in 1654, he immediately visited Sen-in to kokyu (empress's residence) and government officials and tearfully appealed for holding the burial, explaining that cremation should be held based on the emperor's belief.

sen.j: その言の至誠は、聴く者を感嘆させ、ついに朝議においては土葬と決し、これによって皇室においては長きにわたって荼毘が停止されることとなった。
sen.e: The listeners were impressed by his sincerity and chogi (a ceremony at Imperial Court) finally determined to hold the burial, since when the cremation had been stopped in Imperial Court.

sen.j: 明治12年（1879年）、子孫の八郎兵衛が追賞を受け、さらに明治40年（1907年）5月、正五位を贈られた。
sen.e: His descendant, Hachirobei was awarded a posthumous prize in 1879 and also awarded Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) in May 1907.
